adrFormatAddress: 98 Bowery, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: Chinese-style grilled meats & hot pot dishes served in an upbeat restaurant with a party room.

originalText.text: We got an arrangement of skewers and it was delicious overall. The clams were a bit on the chewy side but the flavor was great. Highly recommend getting the chicken skewers! Weâ€™re glad that our server told us to get mild because it was definitely spicier than we expected. Our server was also very attentive and came multiple times to fill our waters (which was highly appreciated given how spicy some of the skewers were for us ðŸ˜…). 10/10 would recommend/come back!

originalText.text: Great vibes, yummy food, awesome service. Would totally come back. Price is pretty good too - $34.99/person for hotpot and $39.99/person for BBQ. They have a really nice broth selections for hotpot. Iâ€™d recommend the spicy golden lemon pot! The skewers in hotpot were delicious as were the normal hotpot dishes.

They have a really nice broth selections for hotpot. Iâ€™d recommend the spicy golden lemon pot! The skewers in hotpot were delicious as were the normal hotpot dishes.

originalText.text:
This was a pleasant surprise. I was craving dry hot pot at 9pm lol decided to give this one a go.

I got the sliced beef dry hot pot. Serving was generous and food was delicious.

But the one thing that stood out to me was the service. In NYC, it's very very hard to find a quality of service that makes you want to tip more. This was it.

Raymond was awesome! This will be my go to spot hot hotpot!

Great food and even greater service. Highly recommended!

originalText.text: We went here for the first time and will definitely be back. The atmosphere was amazing, the music was dope. The food was great. We had shrimp fried rice and dumplings. They have a bar, we ordered a bottle of wine. The servers are great too, we asked a lot of questions about the culture and the guy we had seemed genuinely happy to share . It was just an all around great vibe and I highly recommend this establishment.

text.text: We went here for the first time and will definitely be back. The atmosphere was amazing, the music was dope. The food was great. We had shrimp fried rice and dumplings. They have a bar, we ordered a bottle of wine. The servers are great too, we asked a lot of questions about the culture and the guy we had seemed genuinely happy to share . It was just an all around great vibe and I highly recommend this establishment.

originalText.text:
Amazing Food & Excellent Service!

Setup -- found a perfect spot on our first trip to Chinatown.

Food -- absolutely fantastic food all the way around and one of the best tasting foods in a our trip to New York which included a lot of eating. The menu is big so we decided to try a few different things. Started with the pork dumplings and a spicy skewer (which seemed to be the most popular item). Both were amazing.

Dumplings were fried to perfection and the sauce was a perfect compliment. The skewer was juicy and tasty. Could've definitely eaten a few more of these. Server recommended the hot pot and it was fantastic. Got shrimp and pork. This was a lot of food and every bit melded together for a perfect combination. Didn't have quite as many shrimp, but the were good, but the star of the show was the pork. Tasted so good and cooked in excellent manner. So many vegetables and spices that came together for a truly amazing meal overall.

Drinks -- got a Tsingtao and it was a fantastic compliment to the food we had here.

Service -- was truly outstanding! Our server was helpful, kind, and walked through the various menu items for us with no issue. We tried not be obvious tourists, but there was no issue whatsoever with the great help we received.

Value -- best value we had on the whole trip In terms of food, the quality, and the cost. A mere $38 for all that food with great service; (quite the opposite experience a block away in Little Italy).

Overall -- one of the absolute best overall meals we had while in New York!!
